column1: I am set to arrive at end of October to Thailand. It sounds like Thailand is simply going to stay closed or limited to travelers? Should I just re book now or wait longer until September to see if they change their stance on the USA?

I really want to hold off....Very frustrating. Media is making everything look awful in US which is not the truth....I have reached out to the hotels to see if they would like be reschedule IF the US cannot come...they are all non-refundable. I dont want to go to bars or be around people. Just the beach and relax.
We are looking at May/June 2021. I am going to wait until September to see what happens (mid september). Does anyone see hope in them lifting to the USA? What gossip are you hearing?
Curious #2....if all you want to do is lie on a beach and relax, can’t you do that much closer to home? Could likely be cheaper and no need to endure 20+ hours on a plane in each direction.
There are lots of beaches much closer to relax at."Media is making everything look awful in US which is not the truth"It is true...sometimes the truth hurts!
We like to go to exotic beaches/places. And yes, we are already going to beaches this year close by.

"Media is making everything look awful in US which is not the truth"It is true...sometimes the truth hurts!-------------https://i.postimg.cc/xdqpzwh9/testing.jpgI wonder what Thailand's numbers would be if half of its entire population was tested...
#10 Thailand's rate of positivity is very low (about 1/2 of 1 percent), so they have done an adequate amount oftesting. Whereas the US rate of positivity is 8%.

"I wonder what Thailand's numbers would be if half of its entire population was tested..."-Exactly! -* In the US, over a million recoveries.. Daily death count doesn't seem to match the paranoia from the almost nonstop news reports. (In the US, with over 34 million tests you are bound to find a lot of infected people.)https:/…countries
Shady math..34 million would not equal half the US population.Doesn't matter if they test more in Thailand or not.It would change the US facts.

"#10 Thailand's rate of positivity is very low (about 1/2 of 1 percent), so they have done an adequate amount oftesting. Whereas the US rate of positivity is 8%."----------------------------We will have to wait until Thailand tests 31,000,000+ people, about half Thailand's population, to compare! Few people are going to pay for testing in Thailand. We're talking 6K THB and up! The cases recorded are from symptomatic people. And, as infidel points out: https://postimg.cc/mhhkW383
It wouldn't change the US facts.
What about the deaths?Are those from testing also?
Stay home! Lock your doors!

"death stats mean absolutely nothing."Perhaps not on there own, flashed as a news headline, as you pointed out. However, "excess death" or "excess mortality" figures should, in the future, provide a fairly clear picture of how COVID-19 impacted various countries, states, or communities. The USA's CDC website has a number of pages dedicated to the subject. For example:https:/…excess_deaths.htmhttps:/…mm6919e5.htmSafe travels

Only if they could be believed.Used as a reference point, and a poor one at that. All them people dying in the USA, and I don't know 1 person, who knows even 1 person, who has had C19. And I know a lot of people, spread out all over the country.Sorry, I'm not buying it.
"Media is making everything look awful in US which is not the truth."Stop blaming the media. The situation in the US is bad and it is only going to get worst before it gets better.

"There are lots of beaches much closer to relax at."Unfortunately many of these beaches will probably have to be closed because of the upward spike in several US states. Yes, stay home and make plans for next year instead.

If you look at deaths per capita, the USA is still behind Spain, Italy, UK, Sweden, France and only slightly ahead of the Netherlands, Ireland. And infections per capita is a totally useless number since you have no idea how many folks were sick and not reported due to lack of symptoms or minor symptoms. Governments, media and people are fixated on zeros not facts. It would be good to know how many of the deaths were healthy individuals before getting Covid versus how many were already seriously ill.Like previously mentioned, I know no one in the USA that has or has had Covid (actually don't even know of any friends of friends of friends that have taken ill). The whole country is not an infested zombie zone.Edited: 3:58 am, July 01, 2020

"If you look at deaths per capita, the USA is still behind Spain, Italy, UK, Sweden, France and only slightly ahead of the Netherlands, Ireland."True but the 127,000+ Covid-19 deaths may seem convincing enough to many countries to exclude US travellers.Edited: 4:18 am, July 01, 2020

Like I said .. fixated on zeroes. The per capita figures are essentially percentages and those percentages represent the risk incurred allowing a citizen in. Hence all the mentioned EU countries should be similarily banned.

Tim, you are correct if comparing US to EU for the last 3-4 months, however compare using data from the last 2 weeks which is far more relevant. The US is a train wreck.
"The US is a train wreck."But, disease has little to do with that!

" In some locations people who die in simple accidents, die of old age or other disease, even suicide are counted as Wuhan Virus deaths. "Shh ... never let the facts get in the way of a good spin.

"Hence all the mentioned EU countries should be (similarly) banned."The CURRENT situation in the US and the EU is NOT comparable. It is much worse in the US. You need to keep up with Covid-19 news as reported by the US government.
"What gossip are you hearing?"I heard things. I heard things!
On the subject of testing ... https://postimg.cc/QH1x9g4Z
Hospitalizations are high also.Perhaps, they should not have taken the test?
What ever happened to the virus "magically" disappearing?Whatever happened to Hydroxychloroquine being a "game changer"?Whatever happened to about 15 cases "soon going to be zero"?

"I don't know 1 person, who knows even 1 person, who has had C19."So what! And how is that relevant to the existence of something?Why is your knowing anyone of any importsnce?Sorry to inform you; but, that is not a requirement: no matter how many people you know.Edited: 6:01 am, July 02, 2020
Lock your doors; turn out the lights!

Yes CTM, lets look at hospitalization rates. Looking at weekly rates, not cummulative, which more accurately represents those who are sick at that moment in time and thus the risk of Amercians carrying the disease abroad ... the highest risk group, 65+ years old is 33 per 100,000 or 0.0033% of the popluation. The other age groups run about 12 for 50-64, 7 for 18-49, 3 for teenagers. So overall, less than 0.001% of the population.The agent orange 45 has definitely screwed the pooch when it comes to Covid, I won't argue that. BUT the USA is not the festering disease pot that you and the news media want to make it out as. An aspect that my previous comments about not knowing anyone relates to.With some precautions, face masks, pre-travel covid tests, etc there is no reason the remaining 99% percent of the US population could not travel. You folks were all doom and gloom when China was still traveling to Thailand early on, similar percentages of population effected. But with some controls, tracking, temperature checks, etc Thailand seems to have weathered the storm just fine.Rather than logically viewing the facts and taking proper precautions, the world seems to have preferred to panic and lock themselves away. Is the 2009 movie Surrogates our future?

Still waiting for the daily death count to meet the paranoia the news media is presenting! https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/Somewhere around 2500 in April was the highest daily count I could find blamed on ̶W̶u̶h̶a̶n̶ ̶V̶i̶r̶u̶s̶ Covid 19. (This includes anyone they can blame the virus for even if death is by car accident, falling in a river or old age.) In a normal day in the US around 7700 people die for all sorts of reasons. Time will tell.

7,700 x 365 = 2,813,503 and not even 1 % of population. That's offset by 3,788,235 people born, last year.Edited: 10:56 pm, July 02, 2020
I also do not know one person that has had it or knows someone that had it. Also, the US is HUGE. The entire US shouldnt be dictated off some other states that refuse to wear masks and go to bars.

The number of daily COVID 19 cases is obviously increasing in the US and daily new cases are now higher than in March or April. Currently 15 % of all tests in Florida are positive. Almost 20% in Texas. Extremely high ratios otherwise only found in developing countries like Costa Rica or Colombia.Very little seems to have been achieved in the past 3 months in the USA and unfortunately no indication that things will improve dramatically by October.

If the "travel bubbke" policy is fully implemented, then it is up to the Thai government to do a deal with any country as to who can come and under what circumstances.Although Prayuth likes Trump it's hard to see any circumstances soon when they would welcome US visitors....... Trump's attitude to Covid hasn't helped.
aoertli,The fact that you don't know anyone who has been affected by the virus is irrelevant.I don't know anyone affected by dengue or malaria; does that mean they don't exist or are not an issue?

advenureTim,You can quote all the percentages you want.But, just yesterday Texas had over 10,000 hospitalizations.To their families, friends and love ones, who are struggling with this situation; this is very real.And to the families of the sick, hospitalized and the dead they are more than just a statistic.

USA is low on the totem pole for Thailand tourism. Maybe 1 mill of the the 39 mill for 2019.All of 2.5% of that maybe 20% GDP for tourism. Don't think the USA would even make it into any conversation about 'bubbles' and who should be considered first. China & ASEAN countries .... if & when.You Yanks simple take advantage of the better everything, much closer and holiday in the Americas.

I don't see how anyone can be trying to say that there's no problem with the virus in the US, or that it's 'not that bad' - it's pretty clear there's big problems. It doesn't matter that some of the bigger outbreaks are in certain states or areas of the US, as there's no real restriction on people's movements between states, from an international perspective, the whole of the US is in the same boat.You can say what you want about death rates, and whether the virus is responsible for those. Or whether there's more or less testing skewing the numbers. Fact of the matter is, that the virus is still actively spreading in the US, it hasn't been contained, and therefore any other country will work off the assumption that a person travelling out of the US is at high risk of having the virus. And therefore either will not be allowed in at all, or at least be subject to quarantine measures. Doesn't matter whether your entire family including second cousins twice removed and your neighbour 3 doors down have not had the virus, everyone from the country is a risk.

CTM - I am not marginalizing the losses from the disease, they are emotional drains on the families. BUT this is a Travel Forum, not a health care forum, not an emotional support forum, not a CA (covid anonymous) forum.This thread is about the risks posed by Americans traveling internationally. AND that risk is evaluated by looking at the percentages of infected Americans at any point in time. People allow zeros to blind them and refuse to look past them to see the facts. And the news media loves zeros, because it make for more exciting news. An additional 500 cases sounds so so, but a 50% increase, wow now thats something to worry about. But even a 100% increase in cases means the hospitalization rate goes from 0.001% to 0.002% of the popluation. It would take a one hundred thousand percent increase in cases just to reach 1% of the US population.Bottom line however, is that ANY country with active cases could send the disease abroad via a citizen that is asymptomatic. Therefore ALL countries should require pre-testing and ALL who are clear shoud be allowed to travel. Those tests should be given twice, 10 days prior and within 72 hours of departure and perhaps a swab upon arrival. Countries that want tourists to visit should subsidize the tests within their country (yes you need to get the same tests before flying home to avoid returning with the disease). Countries that want to rejuvinate their outbound tourism businesses should subsidize outbound tests.

The little things that bring smiles .... http://tiny.cc/ui6rrzEnjoy the beauty right around the corner from your own home.ENJOY & BE SAFEEdited: 7:57 am, July 03, 2020

"Thailand proposes a 3 phase “travel bubble” strategy""A travel pact or “bubble” with 3 distinct stages, is expected to be agreed to with countries that have had similar success to Thailand in suppressing the Covid-19 virus and that have gone at least 30 days without recording any new cases. Initially, it’s understood the arrangement will include China, Japan, and Taiwan."https://thethaiger.com/coronavirus/Thailand-…

So reading that, IF approved, and if C19 free for 30 days, and good luck with the latter, I notice that once here, their movements will be restricted. ... " The move is reportedly to focus on safely reopening by using the areas of Chiang Mai, Koh Samui, Krabi, Phuket, and Pattaya, as experimental locations "Surely they'll be 'chipped', well their phones anyway. Even though as I previously stated (deleted), everyone (phones) were chipped already. And you didn't authorize it, and they didn't ask or announce your phones being chipped.Say what .... yea ... your last mandatory system update on your Android or Apple phone, installed a C19 tracking app, that you can't delete (android anyway & probably apple). You can turn it off, and of course it doesn't access your personal or internet activities ..... BUT .... we've all heard those lies before.Welcome to the NWO. No need to chip people, just chip their phone. All for your safety, and brought to you by the fake pandemic. Sheep ..... do try to think outside the box.IGNORANCE IS BLISSIf curious (it's not BS) .... go to settings (android), Google, and it's located there.Edited: 10:12 pm, July 02, 2020

What's currently in the press is obviously just speculation. To limit visitors to only come from countries that are free from the pandemic for 30 days would eliminate China, Japan and South Korea and leave only Taiwan and Vietnam in Asia. That's unlikely to happen. There is no WHO definition of low risk but the EU does such an assessment: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/geographical-d…According to that below 20 cases per 100 000 population within 14 days is considered low-risk. And there are plenty of countries below that threshold.

"To limit visitors to only come from countries that are free from the pandemic for 30 days would eliminate China, Japan, and South Korea and leave only Taiwan and Vietnam in Asia. "A good point.The John Hopkin's website currently shows 3 active cases in Taiwan and 15 in Vietnam.https:/…bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6So, perhaps, for general tourism purposes, Thailand won't be bubbling with anyone anytime soon. It will be interesting to see how this plays out.Take care
If you are wealthy and use private aircraft you might be an exception. (Thai Visa Forum link.)https:/…5 5 5

@49 .... " I don't know anyone affected by dengue or malaria; does that mean they don't exist or are not an issue? "I actually know quite a few having dengue, even a couple with malaria, and that's saying a lot, considering the few folks I associated with here the last 20 years. But yet, don't know anyone with C19, or anyone else knowing anyone infected. That tells me a lot.Believe the MSM hysteria if you wish ... UP2U I believe they have alternative motives (control) for the hysteria and like minded folks are called conspiracy nuts. But down the line, most have come true or been exposed. Your phones were 'all' chipped without your knowledge or authorization last week or so. Quite unnecessary as there are countless C19 tracking apps out their if anyone wanted. But....mandatory with your system update, and you can't delete it. If that doesn't tell you something.....well.......nuff said.
Well, I'm off to the bunker!

I'm giving myself prison release, after the locals are done with their 4 day holiday. May have to pop down to the surf side weekend night market. Noticed it was in full swing last weekend, for the first time in a couple months. Weekly visits get boring, but a little people watching this weekend shouldn't traumatize me too much. Though they are doing the silly mask (most don't wear properly) & temp checks at entry points. Though can enter 'side entrance' to avoid the silly queue. Get my favorite chicken burger & sip a couple.

In response to the OP's question I'd definitely wait. I think there's a perception that the US is not managing the situation well. Forum members can argue about whether it's a real pandemic, what the real numbers are, percentages, infection rates, deaths etc etc till the cows come home but US travelers are on the nose at the moment. Can't see it changing until it "looks like" it's under control and the stats (real or otherwise) begin to reflect that.Also agree with wilcop932, the leader of the US doesn't exactly ooze competence and calm crisis management.
If anyone is still wondering why US citizens are unlikely to be allowed to enter Thailand in the coming months, have a look at the pictures of the US ambassador in Thailand: https:/…
#69 LOL.....another one drunk on the orange koolaid
No local C19 cases for well over a month. Needs for masks ... I think not.Just guessing, but suspect the others just put the mask on for the photo opt.

68."Also agree with wilcop932, the leader of the US doesn't exactly ooze competence and calm crisis management."-Don't believe everything you read or see on TV. If he cured cancer and personally jumped in a river to save people from a bus that fell off a bridge the "fake news" press would find fault. Before the pandemic - record employment stats for everyone! Better than his predecessor! (You know the guy who gave Iran billions of dollars to pay for terrorist acts in Europe. Also the same guy who allowed 20 percent of our uranium supplies to go to Russia.)https://www.newsweek.com/what-we-know-about-… Even now during this pandemic there is stronger than expected employment.https://www.marketwatch.com/story/nasdaq-clo…If any of this is news to you consider your news source is leaving something out!

"Don't believe everything you read or see on TV."My opinion of him is not based on what the media says about him, but rather listening to him directly or reading his tweets.Edited: 7:21 am, July 04, 2020

You're missing my point guys, perception is everything. Regardless of what anyone on this forum believes in terms of management of Covid-19, the US looks "looks like" a shambolic mess at the moment to the rest of the world so US travel is not gonna happen for the foreseeable future. Trump might be the greatest guy in the world but he comes across like a loudmouth incompetent to the rest of the world. You can vote for Will Ferrel for all I care, doesn't bother me or change the outcome.
If the rest of the world bases their opinions on MSM, what can you say.

Listen to the MSM, and the world and life is apparently going to end very soon. WWIII, nuclear war, pending plague / pandemic, maybe before the end of this year .... 555. Global warming, dead seas, melting ice caps, coastal cities under water, civil war in every country, whether race wars or the new crusades. Let's not even talk about the end of births, since everyone is homosexual apparently. I still look to the skies every so often, every day, waiting for that asteroid to take us all out.

I think many people can think for themselves, and simply don't trust the MSM, for good reason. Especially since it's been exposed, it seem no matter what the cause of death, if C19 was present, or even suspected, whether tested for or not, then it's listed as a 'C19 death' per CDC rules. That's just silly.Especially considering the amount of people that die from seasonal flu every year. Add the people who die from HAI, , shy of 100k a year in USA hospitals, and again, if C19 is suspected, then listed as such. Many, most of HAI symptoms, respiratory, are the same as C19.Fairly obvious, CDC, WHO, UN, Gates foundation, that financed the C19 models predicting the doom and gloom scenario, are doing everything they can, (false stats), in an effort to meet those silly numbers. The new CDC rules for listing deaths as C19 are pretty silly. NO CONFIRMED TEST NEEDED.Big pharm is pushing it also, so they can get more billions of tax dollars, above the billions they got already, for that vaccine, that if follows all other flu type vaccines will only be 40 % effective ... if lucky.It's all about the money.Take the 20 - 70k possible seasonal flu deaths a year, add the shy of 100k HAI deaths a year, and how many of those are now being listed as C19 deaths. Can you really trust any of the numbers ???Not taking into consideration, the old people, who were on their last leg to begin with, being listed as C19 deaths, as been reported. Don't even have to add the silly ones, accidents and such reported as C19 deaths, simply because testing positive for coronavirus anitbodies, and sometimes not even specific C19 antibodies, but simply coronavirus antibodies, which most people have present in their bodies.UP2U what & who to believe.
Then, add in COVID's ability to infect certain large gatherings, while ignoring others. https://postimg.cc/sQFdXdDf

#79 - Can't speak for all Americans but for me the ussue is not denial, but a desire for more accurate facts and figures. Not the sensationalistic 'news' we get today.Australia and NZ are getting pats on the back but they haven't been through a winter flu season yet, so no telling what might flare up. The EU bad mouthing the USA is a bit of the kettle calling the pot black.The most dangerous aspect of Covid is the news and social media plague, not the disease itself.

You do make a good point Tim about the Winter Flu. I doubt you would be picking up on the news about that unless you are in Australia or NZ.Very interesting, that Reports of Flu this year compared to last year are very low. The reason has been put down to a number of facts. Firstly all the distancing and large crowds not gathering. Secondly is with the Vaccination, the Government went hard and fast with this, Australia has enough to Vaccinate a large number of the population. I would say they will be throwing away a lot.While we refer to it as winter Flu, you can get it anytime of the year, I got the worst one in November one year. In winter we spend more time indoors and therefore more contact with people , thus allowing it to spread. I got it when in Thailand during their winter , which is quite Hot and Humid . So much like like heat wave in the UK during Summer.The Flu Vax is not 100% . As a person gets older say from 70 years it reduces down to 50%. I look after a old relative and the Doctor is always reminding me to be very care and not to expose him to people with Flu.Chok Dee
"The Flu Vax is not 100%. As a person gets older say from 70 years it reduces down to 50%."Flu vaccination is a "best guess" deal.

VE (vaccine effectiveness) is 10 - 60 % over the 2004 - 2018 period.That's an average of 40.71 % over 14 seasons.https:/…past-seasons-estimates.htmlA tad less for this year so far:https:/…2019-2020.htmlEdited: 6:43 am, July 05, 2020

#93 & #95 - Closing borders to foreigners is not the silver bullet, it is a nationalistic band-aid. A country's citizens can carry the disease into their homeland just as easily.
